engagingSpontaneous: Thrives in less structured and detailed careers

dictionary.accomodating: affording to offer accomodation; obliging; happay and ready to do favours for others.
dictionary.active: having the power or quality of acting; causing change; not dull or sluggish.
dictionary.agreeable: willing; ready to agree or consent.
dictionary.activist: someone who actively campaigns for change.
dictionary.accurate: likes to be precise, executes with care; careful and correct.
dictionary.analysisSyndrome: Like to take things apart and over analyse.
dictionary.convincing: able to change people's mind or opinion with prooof or evidence.
dictionary.coolHearted: calm at heart and in self-control.
dictionary.conforming: State of complying with a set of rules, with a norm or standard.
dictionary.confrontational: the act of confrontating or challenging another, especially face-to-face.
dictionary.complacent: Being self-satisfied with oneself or one's achievements.
dictionary.cool: not showing emotion, calm and in self-control.
dictionary.combative: given to fighting; disposed to engage in combat in a form or way.
dictionary.compassionate: Having, feeling or showing compassion; sympathetic.
dictionary.controlling: Likes to take control over a person or thing; Always wants to take charge.
dictionary.contentious: Given to struggling with others out of jealousy or discord, marked by heated arguments or controversy.
dictionary.controversial: Given to struggling with others out of jealousy or discord, marked by heated arguments or controversy.
dictionary.consistent: having a regularly occuring, dependedable nature or way of living.
dictionary.corporative: willing and able to work with others as a collective body.
dictionary.creative: tending to create things or having the ability to create.
dictionary.confident: very sure of something; very positive.
dictionary.critical: Inclined to find fault or critise.
dictionary.criticise: Inclined to find fault or critise.
dictionary.defendIdeas: Someone who stands his/her ground in their own ideas and repels off any ideas that he/she does not agree to.
dictionary.decisive: having the power or quality in making quick decisions.
dictionary.dependable: able or easily able to be depended on.
dictionary.diplomatic: exercising tact or courtesy; using discussion to aviod hard feelings, fights or argument.
dictionary.determined: always decided at mind and heart; resolute; pocessing much determination.
dictionary.domineering: likes to be bossy, dominant, forceful, commanding, pushy, oppresive e.t.c.
dictionary.detailed: characterized by attention to detail both giving and recieving.
dictionary.effficient: causing effects, producing results; initiating change.
dictionary.easilyDisturbed: extremely alarmed or shocked with ease.
dictionary.erratic: unsteady, random; prone to unexpected changes; not consistent.
dictionary.factOriented: Believing in things that are real and actually exit; Does not believe in fiction or fantasy.
dictionary.firm: having a steadfast, secured or hard personality.
dictionary.friendly: approacheable and easy to relate with in character;generally warm hearted.
dictionary.forgetful: Unable to remember things well; liable to forget.
dictionary.flexible: willing or ready to yield to the influence of others or circumstance.
dictionary.focused: directing all one's efforts towards achieving a particular goal.
dictionary.generalist: a person with broad general knowledge, especially one with the ability to combine ideas from diverse fields.
dictionary.goodListener: Able to be depended on paying attention and listening to what a person has to say.
dictionary.expensive: Having a high taste or standard.
dictionary.harmonious: Showing agreement or concurrence of opinion, will, or action in feelings and decision.
dictionary.humorous: full of humor or arousing laughter; funny.
dictionary.impatient: Restless and intolerant of delays; Anxious and eager, especially to begin somthing.
dictionary.insensitiveToOthers: not expressing normal emotional feelings; unaffected or does not care about the feelings of others.
dictionary.instinctive: Driven by impulse, spontaneous and withouty thinking.
dictionary.indecisive: slow in making decisions; inconclusive or uncertain.
dictionary.impulsive: inclined to make rapid decisions without due consideration.
dictionary.impelling: To urge a person; to press on; to incite to action via motivation.
dictionary.inorganize: To make less organized; to reduce to chaos.
dictionary.judgemental: likes to judge; Being critical and criticise.
dictionary.lackInitiative: Lacks the ability to deal with problems.
dictionary.lackConfidence: absence of trust in oneself and sometimes others.
dictionary.likesChange: likes and can tolerate/ handle new situation/circumstances.
dictionary.logical: In agreement  with the principles of logic; Reasons to the fundamental logic of a system.
dictionary.makesQuickDecisions: having the power or quality in making quick decisions.
dictionary.modest: Not bragging or boasting about oneself or one's achievements, unpretentious, humble.
dictionary.objective: not influenced by the emotions or predujices; Based on observed facts.
dictionary.outgoing: Comfortable in social settings and interactions; Confident in dealing with people especially in meeting new people.
dictionary.patient: Willing to wait if necessary; not losing one's temper while waiting.
dictionary.planAhead: likes to prepare or plan ahead of time.
dictionary.perfectionist: One who is unwilling to settle for anything that is not perfect or does not meet extremely high standard.
dictionary.persistent: refusing to give or let go.
dictionary.passive: Being subjected to an action without producing a reaction; Being inactive and submissive.
dictionary.precise: likes to be exact and accurate.
dictionary.processOriented: Believing everything has to happen (step by step) according to a process or rule.
dictionary.promoteChange: Not necessarily like but supports change.
dictionary.proud: having too high an opinion of oneself.
dictionary.procrastinate: to delay taking action; to wait until later.
dictionary.passionate: fired with intense feeling about something or someone.
dictionary.peopleOriented: like to familiarize with people, their situation or circumstance.
dictionary.picky: demanding to have things just right.
dictionary.questioning: Always asking questions, wondering and doubting, likes to interrogate.
dictionary.restless: Without rest; unable to be still or quiet.
dictionary.responsible: Able to be trusted; reliable; trustworthy.
dictionary.rigid: Having a rigorous and unbending, uncompromising will.
dictionary.respondQuickly: to say something in return; to answer or reply as fast as possible.
dictionary.reasonsToLogic: reasonable in agreement with the principles of logic.
dictionary.respondFast: to say something in return; to answer or reply as fast as possible.
dictionary.resultOriented: believing every action has a corresponding consequence or result.
dictionary.spontaneous: Done by one's own free choice, or without planning; Arising from a momemtary impulse.
dictionary.structured: Having everything planned according to a schedule.
dictionary.stubborn: refusing to move or to change one's opinion; disobedient; firly resisting.
dictionary.systematic: carry things out using a planned, ordered procedure.
dictionary.strongWilled: having force or ability to trust in oneself or belief.
dictionary.talkative: Speaking openly and honestly, neglecting privacy and consequences.
dictionary.teases: To make fun of; to provoke or disturb; to annoy.
dictionary.through: Completely opened at heart and honest.
dictionary.takeControl: likes to take charge, to assume control.
dictionary.tactful: able to deal with people in a sensitive manner.
dictionary.toughMinded: having a strong and resilent mindset.
dictionary.thickSkinned: A coarse, gross person; a prson void of sensibility or sensitiveness; a dullard.
dictionary.tolerant: tending to permit, allow, understand or accept something.
dictionary.understanding: the ability to share the feelings of another.
dictionary.unconventional: not adhering to convention or accepted standard, thinks out of the ordinary.
dictionary.versatile: Capable of doing many things with sufficient skill, knowledge, ability,  or qualifications.
dictionary.visionary: someone who has positive ideas about the future; having foresight.
dictionary.weakWill: lacking force or ability to trust in oneself or belief.
